### getValueAPF() {#a32aa14715eeb813d764fcf20f161f0a1}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const APFloat &amp; llvm::ConstantFP::getValueAPF () const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h/#l00314">314</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h">Constants.h</a>.

### isExactlyValue() {#abc0558cd7175718747da9d910ef1c19a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool ConstantFP::isExactlyValue (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apfloat">APFloat</a> &amp; V) const</>}>
We don&#39;t rely on operator== working on double values, as it returns true for things that are clearly not equal, like -0.0 and 0.0.

As such, this method can be used to do an exact bit-for-bit comparison of two floating point values. The version with a double operand is retained because it&#39;s so convenient to write isExactlyValue(2.0), but please use it only for simple constants.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h/#l00335">335</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h">Constants.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constants-cpp/#l01119">1119</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constants-cpp">Constants.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h/#l00345">345</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h">Constants.h</a>.

### get() {#a5eb8f7a5d3cfdd127ad9db2e425e14eb}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Constant &#42; ConstantFP::get (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; Ty, double V)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
This returns a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantfp">ConstantFP</a>, or a vector containing a splat of a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantfp">ConstantFP</a>, for the specified value in the specified type.

This should only be used for simple constant values like 2.0/1.0 etc, that are known-valid both as host double and as the target format.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h/#l00294">294</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h">Constants.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constants-cpp/#l00983">983</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constants-cpp">Constants.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### get() {#ac698873f7b353f3a37cb8577b74acf72}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Constant &#42; ConstantFP::get (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; Ty, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apfloat">APFloat</a> &amp; V)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
If Ty is a vector type, return a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant">Constant</a> with a splat of the given value.

Otherwise return a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantfp">ConstantFP</a> for the given value.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h/#l00298">298</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h">Constants.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constants-cpp/#l00999">999</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constants-cpp">Constants.cpp</a>.

### getNaN() {#ab21342133676f10340dc3f541b128f24}

<MemberDefinition

## Private Static Functions

### get() {#a26693a9771140ad17525daf3de7a1255}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ConstantFP &#42; ConstantFP::get (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llvmcontext">LLVMContext</a> &amp; Context, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/elementcount">ElementCount</a> EC, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apfloat">APFloat</a> &amp; V)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Return a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantfp">ConstantFP</a> with the specified value and an implied <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a>.

The type is the vector type whose element type has the same floating point semantics as the value.
